audio_description: Assalamu Alaikum dear viewers! A warm welcome to all my lovely subscribers, both new and old. Today, I'm sharing with you a delicious Kolkata-style chicken biryani recipe. Be sure to try this on Eid. Many of you had requested this recipe for a long time—specifically Kolkata-style chicken biryani—so here it is!

audio_description: To make chicken biryani, start with 400 grams of oil. Once the oil is hot, reduce the flame to medium and add 300 grams of finely chopped onions. Fry the onions on medium flame until golden brown—this is called 'beresta'.

audio_description: As you can see, the onions have fried well. Quickly remove them. Always use more onions when making beresta because they shrink when fried. I used 300 grams of onions and 400 grams of oil, which is the amount needed for this biryani.
